ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 42. In the past 6 months, has [he/she] taken drugs or drunk alcohol at all?
43. In the past 6 months, was there a time when _________ seemed much too happy or excited?
IF YES, A. Was [he/she] only like that when [he/she] had taken drugs or drunk alcohol?
B. Was [he/she] so much more happy or excited than usual, that you or others thought something was wrong with [him/her]?
1. Has there ever been a period of time when you were not your usual self and you had much more energy than usual
IF YES, A. Was [he/she] only like that when [he/she] had taken drugs or drunk alcohol?
B. Did [he/she] have so much more energy than usual, that you or others thought something was wrong with [him/her]?
45. In the past 6 months, was there a time when [he/she] seemed very sure of [him/herself] for no good reason, like [he/she] believed [he/she] could do anything and it would work out?
IF YES, A. Was [he/she] only like that when [he/she] had taken drugs or drunk alcohol?
B. Was [he/she] so much more confident than usual, that you or others thought something was wrong with [him/her]?
46. Was there a time when [he/she] was very irritable, jumpy or edgy, so that any little thing would upset [him/her] or make [him/her] mad?
IF YES, A. Was [he/she] only like that when [he/she] had taken drugs or drunk alcohol?
B. Was [he/she] so much more irritable than usual, that you or others thought something was wrong with [him/her]?
47. Has [he/she] seemed very suspicious, like [he/she] didnt trust other people or that [he/she] had to watch out for them?
IF YES, A. Was [he/she] only like that when [he/she] had taken drugs or drunk alcohol?
B. Was [he/she] so much more suspicious than usual, that you or others thought something was wrong with [him/her]?
NOTE 5: WERE ANY  RESPONSES CODED FOR QS 43 TO 47?
48. When [he/she] [felt/had] [TOO HAPPY/ A LOT MORE ENERGY/ VERY SURE OF HIM/HERSELF/ IRRITABLE/ SUSPICIOUS], did it last more than one day?
IF YES, A. Did it last as long as a week?
49. When [he/she] [was/had] [TOO HAPPY/ A LOT MORE ENERGY/ VERY SURE OF HIM/HERSELF/ IRRITABLE/ SUSPICIOUS], did [he/she] feel that [he/she] was special or a very important person?
50. Did [he/she] feel very sure that [he/she] could do things other people couldnt do?
51. When ________ seemed that way, did [he/she] sleep a lot less than usual?
IF YES, A. Even though [he/she] got less sleep, did [he/she] still seem to have plenty of energy?
52. When [he/she] [was/had] [TOO HAPPY/ A LOT MORE ENERGY/ VERY SURE OF HIM/HERSELF/ IRRITABLE/ SUSPICIOUS], did [he/she] talk much more or much faster or more loudly than usual?
IF YES, A. Did [he/she] talk so much that [his/her] voice became hoarse?
B. When [he/she] talked like that, was it hard to interrupt [him/her]?
IF YES, C. Even when [he/she] was interrupted, did [he/she] often keep right on talking?
53. When [he/she] was that way, was it hard for you or others to follow what [he/she] was saying?
IF YES, A. Was that because what [he/she] said seemed mixed-up or confused?
B. Did it seem to you that [his/her] mind was speeded up and working too fast?
54. When ________ [was/had] [TOO HAPPY/ A LOT MORE ENERGY/ VERY SURE OF HIM/HERSELF/ IRRITABLE/ SUSPICIOUS], was it much harder for [him/her] to keep [his/her] mind on what [he/she] was doing?
IF YES, A. Was that because [he/she] kept finding new things that interested [him/her]?
B. Was that a change from the way [he/she] usually was?
55. During that time, did [he/she] become much more active?
IF YES, A. When [he/she] was more active did [he/she] want to be with other people most of the time?
B. When [he/she] felt that way, did [he/she] work extra hard at (school/ [his/her] job)?
IF YES, C. Did [he/she] get a lot more done than usual?
D. Did [he/she] start a lot of new projects or become involved in many new activities?
E. Did [he/she] seem unusually restless, so that [he/she] had to be on the go all the time?

56. When ___ [was/had] [TOO HAPPY/ A LOT MORE ENERGY/ VERY SURE OF HIM/HERSELF/ IRRITABLE/ SUSPICIOUS], did [he/she] do things that later [he/she] wished [he/she] hadnt done, like spending a whole lot of money or giving things away?

Module C: Mood Disorders - Mania/Hypomania (MAN/HYPOMAN). Excited/full of energy in past year
When [he/she] seemed excited like this, was that very different from how [he/she] usually is?
Was [he/she] excited like this a lot of the time for as long as four days in a row?
Was [he/she] like this for as long as a week?
